issue.title: Notifications do not popup if app installed from *.dmg on macOS
issue.body:
How to reproduce:

1. Install Bitcoin Core from downloaded `dmg` file (e.g., [v0.17.1rc1](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-0.17.1/test.rc1/bitcoin-0.17.1rc1-osx.dmg)).

2. Run with `-regtest`.

3. Generate a new block. A new notification is expected to popup.

Actually, this notification is present in Notification Center; but _it did not popup_.

The same Bitcoin Core version being self-compiled (`git checkout v0.17.1rc1`) works as expected.

issue.title: v0.17.1 testing
issue.body:
Link to binaries:
* v0.17.1rc1 : https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-0.17.1/test.rc1/

Let us know which version you tested on which operating system. You can also report issues you found here, but please search Github for known issues first.

See [Release Notes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v0.17.1rc1/doc/release-notes.md#notable-changes) for a list of changes, for an idea what to test.

Maintainers: feel free to close if you think this is a bad idea :-)

---
tACK v0.17.1rc1 on macOS 10.14.1:
* tested installing from (unsigned) DMG
* testing sending coins

events.body: Which version of macOS are you testing/have tested on?
Haven't tested this yet, but reminds me of #11840

issue.title: [WIP] [do not merge] fix OSX notification bug

events.body:
This is not a bug, it's a feature.

When Bitcoin Core is the most foreground application, such notifications go silently to the Notification Center (top right global menu bar).

If you put the Bitcoin Core GUI in the background and trigger a notification via RPC (`generatetoaddress` as example) you will get a banner (popup) notification.

I guess it would be possible to overwrite the `NSUserNotificationDelegate` and make it always popup.

https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/nsusernotification#//apple_ref/occ/instp/NSUserNotification/presented

@jonasschnelli 
> This is not a bug, it's a feature.
> 
> When Bitcoin Core is the most foreground application, such notifications go silently to the Notification Center (top right global menu bar).

Tested. It works as described.
But why do notifications popup for a self-compiled build running from the command line?

> But why do notifications popup for a self-compiled build running from the command line?

Not entirely sure but maybe because the command line is the process initiator and not the front most application?

issue.title: qt: Fix broken notificator on GNOME
issue.body:
Fix #14994; that bug was introduced in #14228 (that was my fault).

~Also this commit explicit separates~ There are two functions of the tray icon:
 - a system tray widget (`QSystemTrayIcon::isSystemTrayAvailable() == true`)
 - a high-level notificator via balloon messages (`QSystemTrayIcon::supportsMessages() == true`)

~These properties are mutually independent,~ e.g., on Fedora 29 + GNOME:
```
QSystemTrayIcon::isSystemTrayAvailable() == false;
QSystemTrayIcon::supportsMessages() == true;
```

UPDATE:

`supportsMessages()` makes no sense without `isSystemTrayAvailable()`: `QSystemTrayIcon::showMessage()` just not working on Fedora 29 + GNOME.
